text.text: What are the two approaches to patient payment plans in ZOLL Billing?

text:
The two approaches to patient payment plans in ZOLL Billing are:

1. **Installment Billing:** This is a type of payment plan that allows patients to pay for their medical expenses over time. Patients can choose to make monthly payments, biweekly payments, or weekly payments.
2. **Deferred Billing:** This is a type of payment plan that allows patients to delay paying for their medical expenses until they are able to do so. Patients can choose to defer payment for up to 12 months.

text.text: Can you explain the automated patient payment plan process?

text: To enable automated payment plans, you need to check the box and enter the number of days between plan payments. When this option is checked, all accounts with payment plans defined and enabled will be automatically monitored for timely payment.

text.text: What are the key configurations involved in setting up an automated patient payment plan?

text: The key configurations involved in setting up an automated patient payment plan are: Automate patient payment plans Number of days between payment plan payments Save Cancel Click here for more information 35 Invoice a patient by default Suspend patient billing by default

text.text: How can you configure the payment schedule for automated patient payment plans?

text: Before turning on a payment plans, set the schedule in on the Patient Billing page. This schedule tells the system how often to send a patient statement and the maximum statements to send. You can edit this schedule at any time by clicking the edit pencil.

text.text: In an automated payment plan, what happens if a patient fails to make a payment within the specified time frame?

text: If a patient fails to make a payment within the specified time frame, they will be removed from the plan and their account will go back to standard statement processing. When an account is automatically taken off a payment plan, the claim status changes to "Suspended - Final statement sent".

text.text: Describe the process of enabling a payment plan for a patient account.

text: To enable a payment plan for a patient account, you can do so in several places: Account page, Patient Billing page, and Patient responsibility tab. Once you have negotiated with the patient, you can turn on the payment plan and enter the monthly payment plan amount.

text.text: How does the manual patient payment plan process differ from the automated process?

text: In the manual process, you negotiate the amount the patient can pay and then frequently check the patient's account for non-payment. In the automated process, the system monitors accounts on payment plans and automatically disables payment plans after 45-days of non-payment.

text.text: What are the steps involved in setting up a manual patient payment plan?

text: The steps to set up a patient plan that is not automated is the same as the automated steps with the exception that the "Automate patient payment plans" setting is not enabled and the number of days that patient has to pay within a statement period is not set.

text.text: How does the system handle accounts that are taken off a payment plan due to non-payment in a manual payment plan setup?

text: When an account is automatically taken off a payment plan, the claim status changes to "Suspended - Final statement sent".

text.text: How can you view information about patients enrolled in payment plans

text: To view information about patients enrolled in payment plans, you can use the "Payment plans" tab on the Patient Billing page. This tab shows a list of patients that have a negotiated payment. You can click the icon under the "Review" column to remove the patient from the plan, determine future steps, and view open claims and patient statements.

text.text: What steps are involved in removing a patient from a payment plan manually?

text: To remove a patient from a payment plan manually, you can use the "Payment plans" tab on the Patient Billing page. You can click the icon under the "Review" column to remove the patient from the plan, determine future steps, and view open claims and patient statements.

text.text: Is there an audit trail for activities related to payment plans in ZOLL Billing? If yes, how can you access it?

text: To get to the company Audit Trail, click Analytics on the navigation bar and then click Audit Trail. The company audit trail lists actions performed by ZOLL Billing users. Here you will find the user's name, the date, a brief description of the action taken, and the area that was impacted by the action.

text.text: How to take a patient off a payment plan?

text: To take a patient off a payment plan, you can use the "Payment plans" tab on the Patient Billing page. You can click the icon under the "Review" column to remove the patient from the plan, determine future steps, and view open claims and patient statements.

text.text: Who's on a payment plan?

text: To find out who's on a payment plan, you can use the "Payment plans" tab on the Patient Billing page. A list of patients with a plan will display.

text.text: Patient Billing page

text: To get to the Patient Billing page, hover over Claims on the navigation bar and click Patient Billing. The Patient Billing page has the following tabs: Active, Final statement pending, Final statement sent, Collections letter sent, Other suspensions, Estates, Payment plans.

text.text: How to Enable the payment plan for the account?

text: You can enable the payment plan for the account in several places. You can slide the payment plan toggle to the right on the: Account page > Patient responsibility tab. Patient Billing page > Claims > Patient Billing > review icon.

text.text: Setting the payment schedule

text: The payment schedule tells the system how often to send a patient statement and the maximum statements to send. You can edit this schedule at any time by clicking the edit pencil.

text.text: Enabling the payment plan for the account

text: You can enable the payment plan for the account in several places. You can slide the payment plan toggle to the right on the: Account page > Patient responsibility tab. Patient Billing page > Claims > Patient Billing > review icon.

text.text: Automated patient payment plans

text: To do that, hover over Manage on the navigation bar, click Settings, and then click the Configuration tab. Scroll down to the bottom and find "Automated payment plan". When this option is checked, all accounts with payment plans defined and enabled will be automatically monitored for timely payment. Then enter the number of days between plan payments and click Save.

text.text: Patient Payment Plan

text: To track accounts that are close to being disabled, we added a new column on the Patient Billing page > "Payment plan" tab called "Days since last payment". This column displays the difference in the number of days from the last statement to the last payment, or if there is no payment, the days between the last statement and the start of the payment plan.
